algorithms.compGeometry

Class PerimeterFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.compGeometry.PerimeterFinder

  • public class PerimeterFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    class to create a map of rows with start and stop column bounds (inclusive) for each row to bound the area occupied by given points while including also groups of points that are completely embedded in the point set though not part of the point set. Those embedded points are retrievable separately. The data structure is somewhat like a concave hull. It's used to help quickly scan a region and not include the tops of mountains that the sky concave hull is bent around, for example.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> find(java.util.Set<PairInt> points,
                                                                     int[] outputRowMinMax,
                                                                     int imageMaxColumn,
                                                                     java.util.Set<PairInt> outputEmbeddedGapPoints)
        For the given points, find the ranges of columns that bound the points that are contiguous and the points that are completely enclosed within points but not part of the set. This returns an outline of the points attempting to correct for concave portions of the hull, that is, it is roughly a concave hull that includes embedded PairInts that are not in the set points.
        Parameters:
        points -
        outputRowMinMax - output populated as the min and max of rows are determined.
        imageMaxColumn - maximum column index of image (used to understand when a pixel is in the last column)
        outputEmbeddedGapPoints - a return variable holding the found embedded points that are not in the "points" set, but are enclosed by it.
        Returns:
        map w/ key being row number, value being a list of column ranges that inclusively bound the points in that row.

      • findEmbeddedGivenRowData

        public java.util.Set<PairInt> findEmbeddedGivenRowData(int[] rowMinMax,
                                                       int imageMaxColumn,
                                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> rowColRanges)
        For the given points, find the ranges of columns that bound the points that are contiguous and the points that are completely enclosed within points but not part of the set. This returns an outline of the points attempting to correct for concave portions of the hull, that is, it is roughly a concave hull that includes embedded PairInts that are not in the set points.
        Parameters:
        rowMinMax -
        imageMaxColumn -
        rowColRanges -
        Returns:

      • findRowColRanges

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> findRowColRanges(java.util.Set<PairInt> points,
                                                                          int minX,
                                                                          int maxX,
                                                                          int minY,
                                                                          int maxY)
        for the given points, find the ranges of contiguous columns and return that by row. runtime complexity is O((maxX-minX+1)*(maxY-minY+1)), so this is larger than O(N) for points datasets that are less dense than the min max range.
        Returns:
        a map with key = row, value = list of contiguous points in the row.

      • findContiguousGaps

        protected java.util.List<java.util.List<PerimeterFinder.Gap>> findContiguousGaps(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> rowColRanges,
                                                                                 int minX,
                                                                                 int maxX,
                                                                                 int minY,
                                                                                 int maxY)
        Find the gaps in rowColRanges and put them in same group if they are connected. Note that diagonal pixels are not considered connected (though this may change if test cases show they should be).
        Parameters:
        rowColRanges -
        minX -
        maxX -
        minY -
        maxY -
        Returns:

      • findBoundedGaps

        protected java.util.List<java.util.List<PerimeterFinder.Gap>> findBoundedGaps(java.util.List<java.util.List<PerimeterFinder.Gap>> contiguousGapGroups,
                                                                              int minY,
                                                                              int maxY,
                                                                              int imageMaxColumn,
                                                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> rowColRanges)
        given contiguousGapGroups, return the subset that are completely bounded by points (note that the bounds are given by rowColRanges).
        Parameters:
        contiguousGapGroups -
        minY - the minimum row of the points set used to construct rowColRanges
        maxY - the maximum row of the points set used to construct rowColRanges
        imageMaxColumn - the maximum column index of the image
        rowColRanges - map with key = row number and value = list of column ranges for the presence of points.
        Returns:
        subset of contiguousGapGroups that are completely bounded by rowColRanges

      • getBorderPixels

        public java.util.Set<PairInt> getBorderPixels(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> rowColRanges,
                                              int[] rowMinMax,
                                              int imageMaxColumn,
                                              int imageMaxRow)
        find the pixels which are the borders of rowColRanges including concave pixels, but excluding any pixels that are the image border pixels. Note that rowColRanges has to represent a contiguous point set.
        Parameters:
        rowColRanges - the column bounds for each row of a contiguous point set.
        rowMinMax - the minimum and maximum rows present in the contiguous point set.
        imageMaxColumn - the maximum column in the image from which the point set was derived.
        imageMaxRow - the maximum row in the image from which the point set was derived.
        Returns:

      • findNonMembersConnectedToBounds

        public java.util.Set<PairInt> findNonMembersConnectedToBounds(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> rowColRanges,
                                                              int[] rowMinMax,
                                                              int[] colMinMax,
                                                              int imageMaxColumn,

      • getOrderedBorderPixels

        public PairIntArray getOrderedBorderPixels(java.util.Set<PairInt> points,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<PairInt>> rowColRanges,
                                           int[] rowMinMax,
                                           int imageMaxColumn,
                                           int imageMaxRow)
        NOT READY FOR USE Walk the border to find the perimeter border pixels. Note that rowColRanges has to represent the contiguous point set called points. Note also that this method removes spurs (single pixel width paths without a turn around). If wanted to keep the spurs and still have a connected sequential curve, could copy this method and instead of back-tracking, add the previous point in the linked list at the dead end and continue (for the spurs, there will be the same points leading out and back composing the spur in the final curve - special care is needed for starter points which are spurs and storing "visited" for that altered algorithm).
        Parameters:
        rowColRanges - the column bounds for each row of a contiguous point set.
        rowMinMax - the minimum and maximum rows present in the contiguous point set.
        imageMaxColumn - the maximum column in the image from which the point set was derived.
        imageMaxRow - the maximum row in the image from which the point set was derived.
        Returns:
